title: Day 1 - Predict the Future
mainPromise: You will define what success in 27 days means for you, with clear constraints that keep your idea search realistic.

teachings.title: Define the change you want
teachings.content:
A side hustle is not only an activity. It is a change in your life. If you do not name the change, you will chase random ideas and waste time.

Think in outcomes, not tasks. Start a small online service is a task. Reduce my monthly money stress by earning $200 is an outcome. Outcomes help you choose ideas that fit.

Keep the timeframe honest. You are building something alongside a normal life. Your target should be specific and reachable within 27 days, even if it is small.
teachings.soWhat: If you cannot state your 27-day outcome clearly, you cannot evaluate ideas or make tradeoffs.

teachings.title: Choose a focus lens
teachings.content:
Ideas multiply when you look through a lens. The simplest lens is: who is the customer, what result do they want, and what is the smallest promise you can deliver digitally.

Busy people who want a clear result is a fine starting customer. It is broad, but it points you toward problems that feel urgent: time, confusion, missed deadlines, repeated frustration.

A good promise has a before and after that someone can recognize. Save time and reduce frustration becomes stronger when you tie it to a concrete situation like inbox overload, messy scheduling, or unclear study plans.
teachings.soWhat: If you define the customer and promise today, your idea list tomorrow will be specific instead of random.

teachings.title: Set your decision rules
teachings.content:
You will have more ideas than time. Decision rules protect your time. They also reduce regret because you can explain why you chose something.

A decision rule is not a motivational quote. It is a boundary like: I only pursue ideas I can deliver digitally within 7 days, or I only pursue ideas where I can explain the value in one sentence.

Also create a place to store assumptions. Assumptions are not bad. Unwritten assumptions are bad. When you write them down, you can test them later.
teachings.soWhat: If you do not set decision rules, you will keep changing direction and calling it research.

doBlocks.title: Write your 27-day target
steps: Write one sentence describing what will be different in 27 days.
Choose one money target (even if small) and one time budget.
Write your must not break constraints.

items.label: Set a numeric money target for day 27
items.evidencePrompt: Enter your target amount (number only) and note currency in your log.

items.label: Set a weekly time budget and schedule windows
items.evidencePrompt: List days of week with minutes available each day.

items.label: Listed 3 to 5 constraints you will not violate

doBlocks.example: Outcome: In 27 days, I earn my first $150 from a small online service that saves busy people time. Time budget: Mon, Wed, Sat: 45 minutes. Tue, Thu: 25 minutes. Constraints: No phone calls, digital delivery only, max 2 hours per customer per week.

doBlocks.title: Draft your customer and promise
steps: Write a 2-sentence description of your ideal customer's typical day.
Write a one-sentence promise with a clear outcome.
Write one delivery sentence describing how the service is delivered digitally.
Write one short scenario that shows the moment they decide to pay.

items.label: Described the ideal customer in 2 sentences
items.evidencePrompt: Paste the two sentences describing the customer.

items.label: Wrote a one-sentence offer promise with a measurable outcome
Defined the delivery method in one sentence
Wrote one purchase-trigger scenario
items.evidencePrompt: Write 3 to 5 lines describing the moment they decide to pay.

doBlocks.example: Customer: They juggle work, family, and admin tasks. They often lose time to messy systems and repeated small mistakes. Promise: In 48 hours, you get a simple workflow that cuts your weekly admin time by 2 hours. Delivery: Delivered as a shared doc plus a short screen-recorded walkthrough.

doBlocks.title: Create your decision log
steps: Create a simple decision log template you will reuse daily.
Write your top 3 assumptions about what people will pay for.

items.label: Created a decision log template with fields
items.evidencePrompt: Paste the template fields you will reuse daily.

items.label: Listed 3 assumptions you will test later
Wrote a stop rule for daily work

doBlocks.example: Log fields: Date, Idea, Customer, Promise, Price guess, Evidence found, Next action. Decision rule: If I cannot describe delivery in 2 sentences, it is not ready. Stop rule: When today's checkboxes are done, I stop and save artifacts.

outputs: Weekly time budget schedule and constraints list
Ideal customer description, promise, and delivery sentence
Decision log template with rules and assumptions
